item.title: 瑞士总统与美国国务卿讨论关税问题
item.description: 瑞士总统卡琳-凯勒-萨特（Karin Keller-Sutter）表示，她在与美国国务卿马尔科-卢比奥（Marco Rubio）的会晤中谈到了贸易关系，她正试图从周四起避免39%的征税。【原文：Swiss President Karin Keller-Sutter said she talked about trade relations in her meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio as she attempts to avert a 39% levy as of Thursday.】

item.title: 全球股市上涨，纽约市养老金收益超过 10
item.description: 纽约市的五家养老金公司在上一财年的投资业绩超过了预期目标，有望为纽约市节省数亿美元的退休缴费，因为他们从弹性十足的股票市场中获利。【原文：New York City’s five pensions beat their investment targets in the past fiscal year, promising to save the city hundreds of millions of dollars in retirement contributions as they profit from resilient stock markets.】

item.title: 伊石油将斥资 5 亿美元收购道达尔在阿根廷的页岩资产
item.description: 阿根廷国营能源公司 YPF SA 同意以 5 亿美元的价格收购道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）在瓦卡穆埃尔塔页岩区的部分资产，尽管投资者对亲市场的总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）持乐观态度，但国际石油巨头仍在继续剥离在该国的种植面积。【原文：Argentina’s state-run energy firm YPF SA agreed to buy some of TotalEnergies SE’s assets in the Vaca Muerta shale patch for $500 million, as international oil giants continue to divest acreage in the country despite investor optimism about pro-market President Javier Milei.】

item.title: 关税激增后瑞士企业重新思考全球战略
item.description: 西蒙-米歇尔不能冒险再等下去了。【原文：Simon Michel couldn’t take the risk of waiting any longer.】

item.title: 在欧佩克+增加更多原油后，沙特提高了对亚洲的原油价格
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯连续第二个月上调原油价格，表明在欧佩克+继续增加供应的情况下，该国对原油需求充满信心。【原文：Saudi Arabia raised crude prices for a second-consecutive month, signaling confidence in demand for its barrels as OPEC+ continues to ramp up supply.】

item.title: 格伦科尔美国上市计划失败，S&P 500 指数被认为遥不可及
item.description: Glencore Plc 决定继续在伦敦证券市场上市，这显示了指数基金的力量。【原文：Glencore Plc’s decision to keep its stock-market listing in London shows the power of index funds.】

item.title: 特朗普顾问力推临时美联储理事填补空缺席位
item.description: 据熟悉相关讨论的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普的顾问们正在鼓励他提名一位临时美联储理事来填补即将空缺的央行董事会席位。【原文：Donald Trump’s advisers are encouraging him to nominate a temporary Federal Reserve governor to fill the soon-to-be vacant seat on the central bank’s board, according to people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 花旗电台称加纳军用直升机在阿散蒂地区坠毁
item.description: 据 Citi Fm 报道，一架从首都阿克拉飞往奥布阿西的加纳军用直升机坠毁。【原文：A Ghanaian military helicopter traveling to Obuasi from Accra, the capital, has crashed, Citi Fm reported.】

item.title: 币安对加密货币的控制力面临市场考验
item.description: Coinbase 是加密货币中最接近蓝筹股的名字：这家蓬勃发展的交易所今年加入了 S&P 500 指数，市值一度飙升 69% 至 1060 亿美元。【原文：Coinbase is the closest thing crypto has to a blue-chip name: a booming exchange that joined the S&P 500 this year and at one point surged 69% to a $106 billion market value.】

item.title: 美国考虑在印度关税之外惩罚俄罗斯的方案
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对印度购买俄罗斯石油征收 25% 的额外关税，这可能只是他在周五最后期限到来之前对莫斯科能源收入开出的第一枪，因为美国正在权衡各种方案，以促使弗拉基米尔-普京总统结束对乌克兰的战争。【原文：President Donald Trump’s additional 25% tariff on India for its purchases of Russian oil could be just the first shot he aims at Moscow’s energy revenues ahead of a Friday deadline, as the US weighs options to get President Vladimir Putin to end the war against Ukraine.】

item.title: 尼尔-杜塔的 "肠胃检查"：三种经济
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 能源转移公司将建造价值 53 亿美元的得克萨斯州至亚利桑那州天然气管道
item.description: Energy Transfer LP 正在推进耗资 53 亿美元建造一条从二叠纪盆地通往新墨西哥州和亚利桑那州市场的天然气管道的计划。【原文：Energy Transfer LP is moving forward with plans to build a $5.3 billion natural gas pipeline from the Permian Basin to markets in New Mexico and Arizona.】

item.title: 非洲金融公司称 "偏见溢价 "使非洲每年损失 750 亿美元
item.description: 非洲金融公司（Africa Finance Corp. ）总裁表示，错误的风险定价和对违约的错误认识导致非洲国家每年损失数十亿美元的额外借贷成本和收入损失。【原文：Mispriced risk and flawed perceptions of default are costing African nations billions of dollars a year in additional borrowing costs and lost revenue, according to Africa Finance Corp.’s president.】

item.title: 特朗普对印度购买俄罗斯石油追加 25% 关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）签署了一项行政命令，对印度购买俄罗斯能源征收25%的额外关税。【原文：US President Donald Trump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on India over its purchase of Russian energy, the White House said Wednesday hours after talks between the US and Russia over the war in Ukraine failed to yield a breakthrough.】

item.title: TPG 为增长基金融资 48 亿美元，超过最初目标
item.description: TPG 公司为其最新基金募集了 48 亿美元，该基金主要投资于快速成长的早期公司。【原文：TPG Inc. gathered $4.8 billion for the latest iteration of a fund that bets on rapidly growing earlier-stage companies.】

item.title: Shopify 股价大涨，超越 RBC 成为加拿大最大股票
item.description: Shopify Inc.周三公布了被花旗集团称为 "井喷式 "的季度业绩，一跃成为加拿大最有价值的公司。【原文：Shopify Inc. surged Wednesday to become the most valuable company in Canada after reporting what Citigroup called a “blowout” quarterly performance.】

item.title: 公司在夏季低潮来临前挤出更多债券销售额
item.description: 本周三，美国管道运营商 Oneok 公司和德国宝马汽车公司等六家公司率先出售投资级债券，因为发行商在典型的夏季经济放缓可能导致本月晚些时候债券发行停滞之前挤出了更多的销售机会。【原文：US pipeline operator Oneok Inc. and BMW AG are leading six companies selling investment-grade bonds on Wednesday as issuers squeeze in more sales before the typical summer slowdown likely brings issuance to a halt later this month.】

item.title: 交易员解析公司业绩，美国股市攀升
item.description: 美国股市在周二下跌后小幅上涨，原因是投资者将注意力转移到了公司业绩上。【原文：US stocks rose modestly after Tuesday’s losses as investors shifted their focus to corporate results.】

item.title: 智利比索因央行出人意料的储备计划而暴跌
item.description: 智利央行宣布计划增加国际储备后，智利比索周三暴跌，这令投资者感到意外，因为智利央行曾多次表示对外汇储备水平感到满意。【原文：Chile’s peso tumbled Wednesday after the central bank announced plans to build up its international reserves, surprising investors after it had repeatedly said it was comfortable with the level of foreign currency holdings.】

item.title: OpenAI 以每年 1 美元的价格向美国政府工作人员提供 ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI 正在向美国联邦机构提供其 ChatGPT 产品的访问权，每年只需象征性地支付 1 美元，以此推动其人工智能聊天机器人被更广泛地采用。【原文：OpenAI is providing access to its ChatGPT product to US federal agencies at a nominal cost of $1 a year as part of a push to get its AI chatbot more widely adopted.】

item.title: PineBridge 因稳定币的潜力而转为看涨美元
item.description: PineBridge 投资公司（PineBridge Investments）已在其多元资产投资组合中转向对美元的超配头寸，加密稳定币的爆炸式增长成为其押注美元的最新理由。【原文：PineBridge Investments has flipped to an overweight position on the dollar in its multi-asset portfolio, with the explosive growth of crypto stablecoins emerging as its newest reason to bet on the greenback.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称近期降息可能是适当的
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，美国经济放缓可能会使降息在短期内变得合适，他仍然认为在年底前会有两次降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said a slowing of the US economy may make an interest-rate cut appropriate in the near term, and he still sees two cuts by year’s end.】

item.title: 电信网络之争是对卡尼人工智能战略的考验
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）领导的政府几天后就要做出一项关键决定，该决定将影响加拿大电信公司数十亿美元的投资；而这一决定却让业内最大的企业产生了分歧。【原文：Mark Carney’s government is days away from a key decision that’s poised to affect billions of investment from Canadian telecommunications companies — one that has divided the industry’s largest players.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织发出警告后，赞比亚债券在新兴市场跌幅最大
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）警告说，赞比亚偿还债务的能力仍然很弱，这打击了债券持有者对改善债券条件的希望，赞比亚的美元债券周三在新兴国家债券中跌幅居首。【原文：Zambia’s dollar-denominated bonds led losses among emerging peers on Wednesday after the IMF warned that the country’s capacity to service its debt remains weak, dampening bondholders’ hopes for improved terms.】

item.title: 沙特开发商 3.36 亿美元 IPO 吸引 360 亿美元订单
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯 Dar Al Majed 房地产公司的首次公开募股吸引了 1,350 亿里亚尔（约合 360 亿美元）的订单，其 3.36 亿美元的首次公开募股吸引了 1,350 亿里亚尔（约合 360 亿美元）的订单，因为外国所有权规则的放宽激发了人们对沙特房地产市场的兴趣。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Dar Al Majed Real Estate Co. drew 135 billion riyals ($36 billion) in orders for its $336 million initial public offering, as liberalized foreign ownership rules spark interest in the kingdom’s property market.】

item.title: 丹佛办公楼价值暴跌将打击债券投资者
item.description: 科罗拉多州一栋办公楼的商业地产债券价值 2.77 亿美元，其中最安全的部分被重新评估，其价值仅为之前的一小部分，利息支付也被削减，因此投资者纷纷涌入该债券，但却面临着巨大损失的前景。【原文：Investors who piled into the safest portion of a $277 million commercial-property bond tied to a Colorado office tower are facing the prospect of steep losses after the building was reappraised at a fraction of its former value and interest payouts were cut.】

item.title: 特朗普与苹果公司宣布新的 1000 亿美元美国投资计划
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将宣布，苹果公司将承诺再投入 1,000 亿美元用于国内生产，这是这家科技巨头为避免对其旗舰产品 iPhone 征收惩罚性关税而增加美国产品生产的最新承诺。【原文：President Donald Trump will announce that Apple Inc. will commit to spend another $100 billion on domestic manufacturing, the latest pledge by the tech giant to increase US production of its products as it seeks to avoid punishing tariffs on its flagship iPhones.】

item.title: 对关税的担忧扰乱咖啡市场，阿拉比卡期货下跌
item.description: 在美国对来自最大种植国巴西的商品征收巨额关税之前，阿拉比卡咖啡期货在震荡交投中下跌。【原文：Arabica coffee futures dropped in volatile trading ahead of steep US tariffs on goods from top grower Brazil.】

item.title: 医疗技术公司 Heartflow 将 IPO 目标提高到 3 亿美元
item.description: Heartflow Inc. 将首次公开募股的潜在规模提高到了 3 亿美元。【原文：Heartflow Inc. increased the potential size of its initial public offering to as much as $300 million.】

item.title: 扎布卡提高开店目标，盈利超出预期
item.description: 由于消费需求依然强劲，波兰连锁便利店 Zabka Group SA 已上调了其在国内市场和罗马尼亚的新店开业指导。【原文：Polish convenience store chain Zabka Group SA has raised its guidance for new store openings in its home market and Romania as consumer demand remains robust.】
